content:
Capybara provides find_field API to find input fields.
find_field('id_of_checkbox', type: 'checkbox') To add assertions for input fields we can use Rspec matcher have_field which has similar usage as find_field.
expect(page).to have_field('id_of_checkbox', type: 'checkbox') In some cases input fields are not found using find_field, specially when input field(s) are added by third party library.
Let’s take an example of toggle component that we recently used to understand this problem better.
<Toggle id="toggleId" name="toggleName" size="large" isDisabled={disableToggle} value={toggleValue} isChecked={toggleValue} onChange={handleToggleChange} /> Adding above component in react code generates following HTML.
In this case, we could not find the checkbox with id, name, value or disabled attributes.
This is because the input was not part of the visible page.
To find such fields we have to add visible option to find_field or have_field APIs.
find_field( 'toggleId', type: 'checkbox', disabled: true, value: 'false', visible: false ) or
expect(page).to have_field( 'toggleId', type: 'checkbox', disabled: true, value: 'false', visible: false )
